name: asyndetically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows or relates to asyndeton (= the act of missing out conjunctions between words or parts of a sentence): His writing often employs sentences that are asyndetically joined together, where the reader might rather expect one principal sentence and a subordinate clause. The announcer's call of the winning goal was delivered asyndetically: "He sets, he shoots, he scores!"
More examplesFewer examplesIn the first line of his famous poem "Howl", Allen Ginsberg delivers the line "starving hysterical naked" asyndetically, with the words not even separated by commas.
